Material used.Description: PET measurements were performed on a Siemens ECAT EXACT HR+ scanner in patients including the index patient, his unaffected homozygous sister, and heterozygous brother.

Readout description.Result Description: Substantially lower dopamine transporter (DAT) binding in both striata of the E64D homozygous EOPD patient, with more severe loss in the right striatum.
Not specifically tested in this assay for the L166P variant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: DAT binding uptake ratios within the physiological range as compared to age-matched controls.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Substantially reduced DAT binding uptake ratios below the lower limit of normal values.

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transiently transfected with cDNA encoding wild-type, E64D, or L166P mutant DJ1-V5-His fusion protein.

Readout description.Result Description: Mild but consistent reduction in protein levels of E64D mutant DJ1 compared to wild-type DJ1.
Markedly decreased protein levels of L166P mutant DJ1 compared to wild-type DJ1.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were reproduced at least three times with similar results.

Basic positive control.Description: Independent lysate of HEK293 cells expressing wild-type DJ1-V5-His fusion protein was used as positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Lysate from untransfected HEK293 cells served as negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression levels comparable to wild-type DJ1.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in protein expression levels compared to wild-type DJ1.

Material used.Description: HEK293 and COS7 cells were transfected with constructs expressing wild-type, E64D, or L166P mutant V5-His-tagged DJ1 protein.

Readout description.Result Description: Approximately 5% of cells expressing E64D mutant DJ1 showed predominant nuclear localization compared to homogenous nuclear and cytoplasmic staining in wild-type.
Up to 80% of cells expressing L166P mutant DJ1 displayed predominant nuclear localization.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated at least three times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ1 expressing cells showed homogenous nuclear and cytoplasmic staining.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Homogenous nuclear and cytoplasmic staining as observed in wild-type DJ1 expressing cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Predominant nuclear localization of DJ1 protein in a significant percentage of cells.

Material used.Description: Crystals of the E64D mutant were obtained by the sitting-drop vapor diffusion method.

Readout description.Result Description: The E64D mutation does not alter the overall structure of the DJ1 protein monomer and dimer compared to wild-type.
Not specifically tested in this assay for the L166P variant.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ1 protein structure was used for comparison.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein structure comparable to wild-type DJ1 with no significant conformational changes.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant structural deviation from wild-type DJ1 protein.
